00:00:01:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:01:220000.Dialogue: How much time do we have?

00:00:03:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:03:170000.Dialogue: Uh, t-minus five hours, 37 minutes To onset of meteor shower.

00:00:07:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:07:120000.Dialogue: Okay, our position is 34.48 degrees north, 118.31 west. That means the azimuth Should be... 168.22 degrees relative to magnetic north With an elevation of 49.93.

00:00:21:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:21:110000.Dialogue: Uh, we have a signal, but there's no frame lock.

00:00:25:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:25:120000.Dialogue: - We did it. We have the west coast feed of HBO.

00:00:33:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:33:170000.Dialogue: Big deal. Every time I watch that show it’s old women putting condoms on cucumbers.

00:00:37:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:37:190000.Dialogue: All right, let's see what's on the east coast feed.

00:00:46:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:46:000000.Dialogue: Not a great movie, But look at that beautiful desert.

00:00:51:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:51:150000.Dialogue: Too bad Sheldon couldn't come with us.

00:00:54:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:54:110000.Dialogue: Oh it's just not the same without him.

00:01:04:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:04:170000.Dialogue: Oh, this sucks I'm switching back to Real Sex.

00:01:12:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:12:190000.Dialogue: Sheldon's log. star date 63345.3 While my colleagues are off Observing the Leonid meteor shower, I have remained behind to complete my paper On the decays of highly excited massive string states. Although my research is going well I do miss the warmth of human companionship.

00:02:03:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:03:230000.Dialogue: And good evening to you, Siam Palace. This is Sheldon Cooper. Yeah, I'm going to be dining alone this evening, So I'll be reducing my usual order. I'd like to start with one quarter Of the assorted appetizers plate And, uh, one half of the golden treasure for two. Oh, for heaven's sake In the mid-18th century, King Rama IV of Siam divided a huge empire Amongst the colonial powers of Europe In order to preserve his throne. Surely, you, his cultural descendant, Can handle pad Thai and dumplings.

00:02:37:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:37:150000.Dialogue: I need to go-- but you keep in mind That my sharply worded comments On yelp.Com recently took down a local muffin store.

00:03:05:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:05:010000.Dialogue: Oh, for god's sakes, I'm in the bathroom!

00:03:08:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:08:090000.Dialogue: Shall I come back at a better time?

00:03:11:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:11:180000.Dialogue: Get in here! Hurry! Don't you dare knock.

00:03:24:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:24:230000.Dialogue: I slipped in the shower, And I think I dislocated my shoulder.

00:03:29:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:29:040000.Dialogue: Not surprising. You have no safety mat or adhesive stickers To allow for purchase on a surface With a low coefficient of static friction.

00:03:44:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:44:000000.Dialogue: I have a series of whimsical duck stickers On the bottom of my tub.

00:03:48:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:48:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, okay, whatever. Will you just turn the water off and help me up?

00:03:58:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:58:160000.Dialogue: They're whimsical because ducks have neither the need for Nor the ability to use umbrellas.

00:04:03:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:03:200000.Dialogue: Oh, my god. I got to go to the emergency room.

00:04:06:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:06:060000.Dialogue: Well, assuming you're correct that your right humerus Is no longer seated in the glenoid socket, I would certainly think so.

00:04:15:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:15:110000.Dialogue: Well, it seems we've reached an impasse.

00:04:19:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:19:160000.Dialogue: I could call you a cab or an ambulance.

00:04:25:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:25:180000.Dialogue: All right. Let it never be said that Sheldon Lee Cooper Ignored the pleas of a damsel in distress.

00:04:30:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:30:160000.Dialogue: No one's saying that. Let's go.

00:04:32:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:32:120000.Dialogue: Well, it does seem rather ironic That for want of 99-cent adhesive ducks, We both might die in a fiery car crash.

00:04:40:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:40:200000.Dialogue: I wish Penny didn't for want didn't have to work. She loves camping.

00:04:43:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:43:180000.Dialogue: Yeah, that would have been great. You and Penny having sex in the tent While I sit out here and watch Howard hump a cactus.

00:04:51:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:51:050000.Dialogue: Okay, the best I can tell, There are eight other camp-sites nearby. Mostly science nerds like us, But just over yon ridge are two Not unattractive middle school teachers Who reek of desperation.

00:05:04:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:04:100000.Dialogue: Wow. Wonderful. How old are they?

00:05:16:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:16:050000.Dialogue: Come on. You guys can't be that hard up.

00:05:24:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:24:150000.Dialogue: Look-- they gave me home-made cookies

00:05:27:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:27:080000.Dialogue: So, what are we waiting for?

00:05:28:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:28:230000.Dialogue: Relax. I said we'd stop by a little later After they have their nap.

00:05:44:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:44:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, very tasty. Well, so tell me more about these teachers.

00:05:47:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:47:150000.Dialogue: Not much to tell. They had a VW Microbus And were wearing tie-dyed Grateful Dead shirts.

00:06:04:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:04:160000.Dialogue: I see no organizational system in here whatsoever.

00:06:09:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:09:220000.Dialogue: Which panties do you wear on Mondays?

00:06:12:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:12:080000.Dialogue: I don't need panties. I just need shorts and a shirt.

00:06:15:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:15:190000.Dialogue: My mother always told me one should wear clean underpants In case one is in an accident.

00:06:20:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:20:010000.Dialogue: One was already in an accident.

00:06:22:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:22:030000.Dialogue: That doesn't mean one won't be in another, Especially if I'm driving.

00:06:25:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:25:050000.Dialogue: Clothes, Sheldon. I need clothes! Okay.

00:06:29:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:29:140000.Dialogue: Seriously? Those shorts with that top?

00:06:44:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:44:170000.Dialogue: We should have you checked for a concussion.

00:06:46:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:46:230000.Dialogue: okay. Now, you got to help me put these on.

00:06:51:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:51:000000.Dialogue: All right. But don't look. Don't look?

00:06:53:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:53:000000.Dialogue: I don't want you to see me naked.

00:06:55:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:55:210000.Dialogue: Oh. Well, that's understandable. You may be interested to know that a prohibition against looking Is well established in heroic mythology. Uh, Lot and his wife, Perseus and Medusa, Orpheus and Eurydi...

00:07:09:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:09:070000.Dialogue: They always look. It never ends well.

00:07:12:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:12:050000.Dialogue: Ok, now you gotta help me get my arm into the sleeve.

00:07:24:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:24:110000.Dialogue: It doesn't feel like an arm.

00:07:27:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:27:130000.Dialogue: Then, maybe you should let it go.

00:07:51:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:51:130000.Dialogue: Up above the world so high, Like little diamonds in the sky.

00:08:00:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:00:120000.Dialogue: You should... You should write that down Before someone steals it.

00:08:05:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:05:020000.Dialogue: - The meteors don't get here. The earth is moving into their path.

00:08:13:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:13:220000.Dialogue: I can feel the earth moving.

00:08:18:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:18:040000.Dialogue: It's moving too fast. Raj, slow it down.

00:08:44:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:44:120000.Dialogue: It's your American accent. Everything you say sounds stupid.

00:09:00:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:00:070000.Dialogue: For the record, I should let you know This is my first time driving an actual motor vehicle.

00:09:08:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:08:030000.Dialogue: You have your learner's permit, right?

00:09:09:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:09:230000.Dialogue: Yes, and I have logged A considerable number of hours on a simulator.

00:09:16:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:16:150000.Dialogue: All right, can we please go?

00:09:40:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:40:110000.Dialogue: Where is the passenger side mirror?

00:09:43:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:43:210000.Dialogue: In a parking lot in Hollywood.

00:09:48:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:48:080000.Dialogue: - Now, can we please go? - Yes. As soon as I adjust my seat.

00:09:59:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:59:200000.Dialogue: Oh, dear. I'm going to have start again.

00:10:11:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:11:150000.Dialogue: If I could speak the language of rabbits, They would be amazed, and I would be their king.

00:10:32:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:32:200000.Dialogue: I lost my virginity to my cousin Jeanie.

00:10:37:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:37:190000.Dialogue: I would be kind to my rabbit subjects.

00:10:45:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:45:010000.Dialogue: You know what's a cool name? Angelo. That has angel and jell-o in it.

00:10:54:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:54:200000.Dialogue: It was my Uncle Murray's funeral.

00:10:56:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:56:200000.Dialogue: We were all back at my Aunt Barbara's house. Our eyes locked over the pickled herring. We never meant for it to happen.

00:11:05:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:05:070000.Dialogue: One day, I hold a great ball for the President of France, But the rabbits-- they hate me and don't come. I am embarrassed, so I eat all the lettuce in the world And make them watch.

00:11:24:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:24:200000.Dialogue: To this day, I can't look at pickled herring without being aroused. That is a shame.

00:11:38:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:38:230000.Dialogue: Could you please drive a little faster?

00:11:41:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:41:180000.Dialogue: Oh, I think we're going sufficiently fast.

00:11:48:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:48:030000.Dialogue: Nothing. The engine does that sometimes.

00:11:50:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:50:020000.Dialogue: It can't be nothing. The check engine light is on. We need to find a service station.

00:11:53:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:53:190000.Dialogue: No. The light has been on since I bought the car.

00:11:56:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:56:030000.Dialogue: All the more reason To consult with a mechanic before it explodes.

00:12:00:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:00:080000.Dialogue: It's not going to explode. Just keep driving. Warp speed ahead, Mr. Spock.

00:12:06:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:06:040000.Dialogue: Mr. Spock did not pilot the Enterprise. He was the science officer, and I guarantee you that If he ever saw the Enterprise's check engine light blinking, He would pull the ship over immediately.

00:12:18:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:18:100000.Dialogue: Oh, god, I'm gonna lose the arm.

00:12:21:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:21:200000.Dialogue: Oh, oh, red light. Release accelerator And slowly apply... the... brake. Nailed it.

00:12:36:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:36:180000.Dialogue: While we have a moment, may I ask you a question?

00:12:41:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:41:100000.Dialogue: Why do you have the Chinese character for soup Tattooed on your right buttock?

00:12:48:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:48:210000.Dialogue: No, it isn't. But I suppose it does take courage To demonstrate that kind of commitment to soup.

00:12:56:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:56:100000.Dialogue: How did you see it? You said you wouldn't look.

00:12:59:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:59:210000.Dialogue: Sorry. As I told you, the hero always peeks.

00:13:14:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:14:120000.Dialogue: No. That was the last pudding cup.

00:13:25:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:25:040000.Dialogue: That's what he used to eat his pudding, remember? Right! That was so good!

00:13:29:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:29:100000.Dialogue: Sweety and meaty at the same time.

00:13:33:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:33:110000.Dialogue: Wait. Wait, wait. So you're saying We're out of food?

00:13:37:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:37:040000.Dialogue: The only thing in here are blue ice packs.

00:13:39:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:39:190000.Dialogue: I know they're poison, But they look like big, yummy otter pops.

00:13:47:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:47:010000.Dialogue: Oh, god, I am so hungry.

00:13:48:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:48:230000.Dialogue: Me, too. Check and see if we have any more pudding.

00:14:00:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:00:070000.Dialogue: All right, there's no need to bark at me.

00:14:04:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:04:100000.Dialogue: According to the inexplicably irritable nurse behind the desk, You'll be seen after the man who claims to be having a heart attack, But appears to be well enough To play Doodle Jump on his iphone.

00:14:14:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:14:210000.Dialogue: We have to fill these out. "describe illness or injury."

00:14:23:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:23:120000.Dialogue: All right. And how did the accident occur?

00:14:36:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:36:160000.Dialogue: Okay, medical history. "Have you ever been diagnosed with diabetes?"

00:14:49:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:49:120000.Dialogue: Are you sure? You look a bit puffy.

00:15:05:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:05:020000.Dialogue: Okay, moving to psychiatric disorders. "list all major behavioural diagnoses, "e.g. Depression, anxiety, etcetera."

00:15:11:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:11:120000.Dialogue: Oh, my god, what the hell does this have to do with my stupid shoulder?!

00:15:25:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:25:000000.Dialogue: All right. "moles, lesions or other skin conditions." "soup tattoo on right buttock."

00:15:31:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:31:230000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon, Sheldon, look, I am scared and in a lot of pain. Could you please just take a break from being you and try being-- I don't know-- comforting?

00:15:50:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:50:190000.Dialogue: Every thing's going to be fine.

00:16:17:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:17:060000.Dialogue: Will you shut up? We're all hungry.

00:16:20:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:20:230000.Dialogue: Okay, our objective is The boy scout camp-site to the east. Easy target. Big doughy scout master, couple of cubs, most webelos.

00:16:29:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:29:030000.Dialogue: What kind of score we looking at?

00:16:30:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:30:120000.Dialogue: Hot dogs, buns, s'mores. I mean, it's a freaking 7-11.

00:16:33:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:33:060000.Dialogue: All right, Everyone grab flash lights.

00:16:39:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:39:060000.Dialogue: Oh, my god, could it be? Yes! My mother put an "I love you" brisket in my backpack.

00:16:46:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:46:190000.Dialogue: You don't need forks. It's so tender, it falls apart in your hands.

00:17:00:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:00:170000.Dialogue: I feel like we're forgetting something important.

00:17:07:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:07:040000.Dialogue: Maybe a Tupperware bowl of roasted potatoes and carrots?

00:17:17:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:17:230000.Dialogue: Now remember, you were given powerful pain medication And a muscle relaxer, So, uh, don't operate heavy machinery.

00:17:29:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:29:040000.Dialogue: Try not to choke on your own drool.

00:17:32:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:32:190000.Dialogue: Wait. You have To help me get into bed.

00:17:39:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:39:000000.Dialogue: Sheldon has to get me into bed.

00:17:43:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:43:140000.Dialogue: Bet you never thought I'd say that.

00:17:47:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:47:050000.Dialogue: Yes. The charm of your drug addled candour knows no bounds.

00:17:55:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:55:030000.Dialogue: You know, people think you're this weird robot man Who's so annoying all the time, and you totally are.

00:18:03:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:03:040000.Dialogue: But then it's like that movie Wall-e at the end. You're so full of love, And you can save a plant And get fat people out of the floaty chairs.

00:18:16:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:16:120000.Dialogue: That's a fairly laboured metaphor, but I appreciate the sentiment behind it.

00:18:27:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:27:230000.Dialogue: "Soft Kitty" is for when you're sick. You're not sick.

00:18:31:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:31:020000.Dialogue: Injured and drugged is a kind of sick.

00:18:43:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:43:160000.Dialogue: soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur...

00:18:49:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:49:160000.Dialogue: Wait, wait. Let's sing it as a round. I'll start.

00:18:55:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:55:210000.Dialogue: soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur... I'll start over.

00:19:09:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:09:130000.Dialogue: soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur

00:19:20:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:20:030000.Dialogue: Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur. soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur... happy kitty, sleepy kitty happy kitty, sleepy kitty happy kitty, purr, purr, purr purr, purr, purr.

00:19:44:010000.Scene: The camp site. Raj is telling a ghost story with the torch on his face.
00:19:44:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:44:010000.Dialogue: ...And the next morning when he woke up, ...And the next morning when he woke up, He rolled over and realized... duh-duh-duh!

00:19:54:070000.Scene: The camp site. Raj is telling a ghost story with the torch on his face.
00:19:54:070000.Speaker: Raj

00:20:02:210000.Scene: The camp site. Raj is telling a ghost story with the torch on his face.
00:20:02:210000.Speaker: Howard

00:20:07:030000.Scene: The camp site. Raj is telling a ghost story with the torch on his face.
00:20:07:030000.Speaker: Raj

00:20:10:140000.Scene: The camp site. Raj is telling a ghost story with the torch on his face.
00:20:10:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:10:140000.Dialogue: And she was my second cousin.

00:20:13:140000.Scene: The camp site. Raj is telling a ghost story with the torch on his face.
00:20:13:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:20:13:140000.Dialogue: And she was my second cousin.

00:20:18:230000.Scene: The camp site. Raj is telling a ghost story with the torch on his face.
00:20:18:230000.Speaker: Howard

00:20:20:190000.Scene: The camp site. Raj is telling a ghost story with the torch on his face.
00:20:20:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:20:20:190000.Dialogue: Who cares? You slept with your cousin.
